titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Walter Prichard Eaton Papers
titlestmt.author: compiled by Staff of Manuscripts and Archives

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Thursday January 10, 2019 at 08:28

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The papers consist largely of short stories, reviews, criticism, notes, and a small quantity of correspondence.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Walter Prichard Eaton Papers (MS 190). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of F. C. Canfield, 1959; and transferred from the Frank McMullan Papers, 1988.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Walter P. Eaton: worked in the drama department, New York Tribune, 1902-1907; drama critic, New York Sun, 1907-1908; drama critic, American Magazine, 1909-1918; professor of playwriting, Yale University, 1933-1947; free-lance drama and theater critic; author.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The papers consist largely of short stories, reviews, criticism, notes, and a small quantity of correspondence.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright status for collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

The Modern Ibsen - an Interpretation by Herman Weigand

The Quest of the Antique by Mrs. Willoughy Hodgson

paper on the problem of the Christian Church in modern society Fata Morgana -- critical questions and comments asked Lines in the Cambridge Revised Bible

Notes for address or lecture (5 diff. subjects)
2 papers from students with WPE's comments

did.unittitle: To Whom Does the Future Belong
The Twilight of the White Pines
The Clouds on Cannon (15 pps typed)
The Haunt of the Golden Hemlock
The Bird House Stories - The Chickadee
The Rights of Small Notions - A Peep from the Averave Man
Andover Sesquicentennial - May 1928 (an address or poem)
Woman's Place is the Home Green

The Educated Man and the Practical Theater (Yale Phi Betta Kappa - Dec 15,1911)

Holding Up the Mirror to Art
Lament for Susie (Susie is a stove)
Adventures of the Duck Family - How the Little Duck Lost His Squeak (25 pps; also 28 p. variant: plus one page fragment of another copy)
Roffles-Penrod letter/ Penrod seems to be the little duck mentioned in the "squeak" story. Roffles is an enigma.
One of our Old Families (notes on the play only; no dialogue)
Real Realism (a three page short to illustrate the "raw slice of life")

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Addition inventory by Susan Brady 1988 February
Transferred from the Frank McMullan Papers, 1988, Feb 11

This material has been described according to a list found with the material. The list (in folder 1) may have been created by Eaton, Eaton's wife, or Frank McMullan. Some untitled articles and lectures were assigned titles by the creator of the list; they are identified in the following listing by an asterisk (*).

did.unittitle: List of Walter P. Eaton Papers
"Value of Theater from an Ethical Point of View"*
"The Nature and Changing Forms of Drama"
"Mechanical Substitutes for Literature in the Theater"*
"Some Ideas on Stage Decoration" by Ellen Terry
"The Marvel of Mary Anderson" by T. Edgar Pemberton
"The Mission Play of California" by Henry Van Dyke
"Some Pupils of Liszt" by Albert Morris Bagby
"The History and Progress of the Ballet" by Rosita Mauri
"A Four-hundred-Year Old Cottage in Kent, Where Ellen Terry Lives in the Summertime"
"Vision the Source of Achievement" by Mary Fanton Roberts
"Pictorial Successes of Mr. Irving's 'Faust'" by Joseph and Elizabeth Pennell
"The Chinese Theater" by Henry Burden McDowell
